templateAssets.content: Thank you for your interest in CSU Dominguez Hills! This articulation agreement displays lower-division course requirements specific to this major. Students are advised to meet with an academic counselor when planning to transfer to CSU Dominguez Hills and refer to the University Catalog to learn more about this major and its features. Detailed admissions requirements for transfer students are available on the CSUDH campus website. Completion of Statutory Requirements (United States History, Constitution and American Ideals) is a baccalaureate degree requirement for the California State University system and may be met prior to transfer with eligible California Community College (CCC) courses designated as US-1, US-2, and US-3. Completion of Statutory Requirements prior to transfer is most advantageous and strongly encouraged as a number of CCC courses that meet this requirement might also double-count for General Education.

The Music Education Option is intended for students who wish to prepare for a career as a public-school music educator in grades K-12. The degree prepares students to enter into the credential program offered by the university's College of Education (COE). Students who complete the Music Education option are granted a single-subject waiver in music, approved by the CCTC (California Commission of Teacher Credentialing), which allows them to bypass the CSET exam.

Placement/Proficiency Exams

Placement examinations are not graded as pass/fail but are designed to determine one’s placement in courses within the Department of Music.


Music Theory

Student must demonstrate a level of knowledge of music theory appropriate to undertake upper division study in music. These skills include the ability to decode both pitch and rhythmic notation in all clefs, the ability to construct and recognize major, minor, and modal scales, knowledge of proper four-part diatonic voice leading.


Musicianship

The Musicianship Placement Exam requires students to demonstrate a level of musicianship skills appropriate for a university graduate majoring in music. These skills include sight-reading, dictation, and aural comprehension of the common elements of music—rhythm, melody, harmony, timbre, texture and dynamics.  


Piano (as needed)

Every graduating student in Music Liberal Arts and Performance will be required to pass a piano proficiency examination or have record of completing Piano I and Piano II.


For more information please refer to the Music Student Handbook.

Auditions: As an unimpacted department, acceptance auditions are currently not required. Incoming music majors should come prepared to meet or exceed the performance technical requirements of accredited music degrees on the student’s primary instrument, such as proficiency in the 12 major and minor scales. A placement audition is required for placement into the Music Liberal Arts option, Music Education option, or Bachelor of Music degree at California State University, Dominguez Hills. During the audition students will also be considered for scholarship awards.


Lower Division Ensemble Requirement: Students are required to complete a lower division ensemble course at the 100-level and 200-level in a fall semester and a spring semester. 100-level ensembles are to be chosen from: MUS 167, 168, 169, 170, 171, 172, 173, 175, 176, 177, and 178.


Additional Program information may be found in the Music Student Handbook 2024-2025.

items.courseTitle: Music Appreciation: Music in Western Cultures
